title: Physiological Safety
subtitle: Caring for my body's needs
description: Feeling safe, supported, and regulated enough to engage with intimacy.

items.text: ~30 min yoga, meditation, or stretching before tech.
Pre-intimacy checks: rate pain, energy, desire.
Create buffers around pain (soothing routines, downtime).
Safe space to explore intimacy with myself.
My body's limits are data, not a verdict.
Being in pain causes stress and negative thinking — not proof of failure.

title: Emotional Security & Trust
subtitle: Establishing self-trust and boundaries
description: Feeling anchored enough to explore desire with curiosity and openness.

items.text: Daily desire check-in: name wants without judgment.
Pause + body-scan before saying yes or no.
Ability to say yes and no safely, even mid-scene.
My needs are worthy of attention, even as they change.
The goal is presence, not securing a role or person.

title: Relational Connection
subtitle: Exploration of feelings and desires with others
description: Safe, shame-free, consensual connection for touch, sex, and play.

items.text: Share boundaries + needs before engaging.
Name what scares and excites me with a partner.
Bring up arousal openly if it happens during cuddling.
Find 1–2 low-pressure partners (FWB/cuddle/play) aligned on clarity + pace.
Presence of caring and consistent people in my life.
Experience platonic physical intimacy with close friends.
More than one outlet → less projection on any one person.

title: Deep Intimacy
subtitle: Integration and expression of feelings
description: Freedom to express sexuality and pursue deeper, longer relationships.

items.text: Weave sensual rituals into daily life with partners.
Explore sexual scenes outside my comfort zone.
Cultivate longer-term partners aligned on values + pace.
Define exploratory, lofty sexual goals.
Practice fluidity in giving and receiving love, sex, and care.
Intimacy is a garden to tend, not a harvest to grab.
Comparison can be a source of celebration and adoration.
